intro: Veronica ciliolata var. pumila, commonly known as the dwarf speedwell, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. The plant has succulent, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in its alpine habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine displays. Its compact form and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking hardy, decorative plants.
